numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The second thing that I noticed is this.
2. There is no clear cause-and-effect relationship between the status quo of a country and the percentage of people in this country who think that the world is getting better.
3. Brazil has had an unpleasant domestic situation during the past decade.
4. India has had an unpleasant domestic situation during the past decade.
5. A wildfire disaster occurred in Brazil in 2019.
6. Since 2019, Brazil has struggled to keep the Amazon Rainforest sustainable.
7. In 2021, India had one of the worst COVID-19 pandemic situations in the world.
8. Brazil seems to go through a very rough time.
9. India seems to go through a very rough time.

10. There is a huge gap between the percentage of Brazilians in the poll who think that the world has gotten better and the percentage of Indians in the poll who think that the world has gotten better.
11. In Brazil, less than 30 percent of young adults expressed optimism about the status quo of the world.
12. In Brazil, less than 25 percent of adults expressed optimism about the status quo of the world.
13. In India, more than 60 percent of young adults expressed optimism about the status quo of the world.
14. In India, more than 60 percent of adults expressed optimism about the status quo of the world.
15. The U.S. has undergone rough times in recent years.
16. Ukraine has undergone rough times in recent years.
17. Lebanon has undergone rough times in recent years.
18. In the U.S., more than half of respondents expressed positive views regarding the poll question.
19. In Ukraine, more than half of respondents expressed positive views regarding the poll question.
20. In Lebanon, more than half of respondents expressed positive views regarding the poll question.
21. This phenomenon is interesting.
22. This phenomenon is worthy of further investigation.
